decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The proposal represents an over-development of a restricted site providing inadequate private amenity space and resulting in a poor quality residential environment for future residents of the site and neighbouring residential properties contrary to policies: H4.1(Housing Standards & Guidelines) and H4.2 (Residential Density) of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance 1 Design & Layout, 9 Form & Design and 10 Private Amenity Space.

Condition : 2 - The design, bulk and massing of the proposed building would be out of character with surrounding development and would represent an ungainly and overbearing structure, which would be detrimental to the character of the area and the outlook from neighbouring residential properties contrary to policy ENV-B.1.1. (All New Development) of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance 1 Design & Layout and 9 Form & Design.

Condition : 3 - The proposal makes inadequate car-parking provision and would be likely to result in additional kerbside parking, which would detract from conditions of safety and convenience on the public highway contrary to policy T.1.4. (Car & Cycle Parking) of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance11 Roads, footpaths parking & servicing.
description: Demolition of numbers 82-88 Bedfont Lane and erection of 3 & 4 storey block comprising 10 x two bed flats & 2 x one bed flats with 9 parking spaces, bin, cycle store, amenity space and landscaping.
